definition: to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.chinese: 請你們不要大呼小叫了，馬刺的球迷們。

sentences.english: In this phase, the shouts and histrionics will abate somewhat.
sentences.chinese: 在這個階段，大呼小叫和裝腔作勢都將減少。

sentences.english: But don't yell at me next time I tell you to stop drinking.
sentences.chinese: 但下次我要你不要喝酒的時候你別對我大呼小叫。

sentences.english: His 15)boisterousness in the restaurant seemed out of place.
sentences.chinese: 他在餐館裏這樣大呼小叫似乎不太恰當。

definition: shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 呵斥[he1 chi4]
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
